verses.roman:
prabhu kahe,--"kaha rūpa, nāṭakera śloka
ye śloka śunile lokera yāya duḥkha-śoka

synonyms: prabhu kahe—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu said; kaha—please recite; rūpa—My dear Rūpa; nāṭakera śloka—the verse of your drama; ye—which; śloka—verse; śunile—hearing; lokera—of all people; yāya—go away; duḥkha-śoka—the unhappiness and lamentation.
translation: Thus Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu said, "My dear Rūpa, please recite that verse from your drama which, upon being heard, makes all people's unhappiness and lamentation go away."
